pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:0.5.eng: The training rule on asking for something else

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī gilānā hoti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.3.pli: Atha kho aññataro upāsako yena thullanandā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.3.eng: A lay follower went to her and asked,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.4.eng: “Venerable, what’s wrong with you? What may I get you?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.6.pli: Atha kho so upāsako aññatarassa āpaṇikassa gharā kahāpaṇassa sappiṃ āharitvā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā adāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.6.eng: That lay follower then brought back from a shop a kahāpaṇa’s worth of ghee and gave it to Thullanandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.10.pli: Atha kho so upāsako yena so āpaṇiko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ āpaṇikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.10.eng: The lay follower returned to the shopkeeper and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.11.pli: “na kirāyyo, ayyāya sappinā attho, telena attho.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.11.eng: “It seems the nun doesn’t need ghee, but oil.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.12.pli: Handa te sappiṃ, telaṃ me dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.12.eng: Here’s your ghee; please give me oil.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.13.pli: “Sace mayaṃ, ayyo, vikkītaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ puna ādiyissāma, kadā amhākaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ vikkāyissati;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.13.eng: “Sir, if we were to take back goods that have been sold, when would our goods be sold?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.14.pli: sappissa kayena sappi haṭaṃ, telassa kayaṃ āhara, telaṃ harissasī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.14.eng: When ghee is bought, ghee is taken away. Buying oil, you receive that, and you’ll take that away.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.15.pli: Atha kho so upāsako ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.15.eng: That lay follower then complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.16.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.16.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.17.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tassa upāsakassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.17.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of that lay follower,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.18.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.18.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.19.pli: atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.19.eng: Those nuns then told the monks,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.20.eng: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.21.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.21.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.24.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.24.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.26.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.26.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.27.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.27.1.eng: ‘If a nun asks for one thing and then for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.8.pli: taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ viññāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.8.eng: apart from that thing, if she asks for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.9.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.10.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.10.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.11.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.12.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.13.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.13.eng: … ‘Venerables, this thing, which I asked for after asking for something else, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.1.pli: Aññe aññasaññā aññaṃ viññāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.1.eng: If it is something else and she perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.2.pli: Aññe vematikā aññaṃ viññāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.2.eng: If it is something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.3.pli: Aññe anaññasaññā aññaṃ viññāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.3.eng: If it is something else, but she does not perceive it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.4.pli: Anaññe aññasaññā anaññaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.4.eng: If it is not something else, but she perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.5.pli: Anaññe vematikā anaññaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.5.eng: If it is not something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.6.eng: If it is not something else, and she does not perceive it as such, and she asks for that, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.2.eng: if she asks for both at the same time;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.3.eng: if she can show a benefit in asking;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.6.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:0.5.eng: The training rule on exchanging for something else

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī gilānā hoti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.3.pli: Atha kho aññataro upāsako yena thullanandā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.3.eng: A lay follower went to her and asked,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.4.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up, Venerable, I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.5.eng: “I’m not bearing up, and I’m not getting better.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.6.pli: “Amukassa, ayye, āpaṇikassa ghare kahāpaṇaṃ nikkhipissāmi, tato yaṃ iccheyyāsi taṃ āharāpeyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.6.eng: “We’ll deposit a kahāpaṇa coin in such-and-such a shop. Please get whatever you wish from there.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.7.eng: Thullanandā then said to a trainee nun,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.8.pli: “gaccha, sikkhamāne, amukassa āpaṇikassa gharā kahāpaṇassa telaṃ āharā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.8.eng: “Go to such-and-such a shop and bring back a kahāpaṇa’s worth of oil.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.9.pli: Atha kho sā sikkhamānā tassa āpaṇikassa gharā kahāpaṇassa telaṃ āharitvā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā adāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.9.eng: That trainee nun did just that and gave it to Thullanandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.11.pli: “na me, sikkhamāne, telena attho, sappinā me attho”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.11.eng: “I don’t need oil; I need ghee.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.12.pli: Atha kho sā sikkhamānā yena so āpaṇiko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ āpaṇikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.12.eng: The trainee nun returned to the shopkeeper and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.13.pli: “na kira, āvuso, ayyāya telena attho, sappinā attho, handa te telaṃ, sappiṃ me dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.13.eng: “It seems the nun doesn’t need oil, but ghee. Here’s your oil; please give me ghee.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.14.pli: “Sace mayaṃ, ayye, vikkītaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ puna ādiyissāma, kadā amhākaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ vikkāyissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.14.eng: “Venerable, if we were to take back goods that have been sold, when would our goods be sold?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.15.pli: Telassa kayena telaṃ haṭaṃ, sappissa kayaṃ āhara, sappiṃ harissasī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.15.eng: When oil is bought, oil is taken away. Buying ghee, you receive that, and you’ll take that away.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.16.pli: Atha kho sā sikkhamānā rodantī aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.16.eng: The trainee nun started to cry.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.19.pli: Atha kho sā sikkhamānā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.19.eng: and she told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.20.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.20.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.21.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.21.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā get one thing in exchange and then something else?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.22.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.22.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.25.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.25.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā get one thing in exchange and then something else?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.27.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.27.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.28.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:1.28.1.eng: ‘If a nun gets one thing in exchange and then something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.8.pli: taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ cetāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.8.eng: apart from that thing, if she gets something else in exchange, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.9.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.10.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.10.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.11.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.12.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.13.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.13.eng: … ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange, having first gotten something else in exchange, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.17.1.pli: Aññe aññasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.17.1.eng: If it is something else and she perceives it as such, and she gets that in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.18.pli: Aññe vematikā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.18.eng: If it is something else, but she is unsure of it, and she gets that in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.19.pli: Aññe anaññasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.19.eng: If it is something else, but she does not perceive it as such, and she gets that in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.20.pli: Anaññe aññasaññā anaññaṃ cetāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.20.eng: If it is not something else, but she perceives it as such, and she gets that in exchange, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.21.pli: Anaññe vematikā anaññaṃ cetāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.21.eng: If it is not something else, but she is unsure of it, and she gets that in exchange, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.22.eng: If it is not something else, and she does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.24.eng: if she gets both in exchange at the same time;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.25.eng: if she can show a benefit in doing the exchange;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.27.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np5:2.28.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:0.5.eng: The training rule on exchanging what belongs to the Sangha

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upāsakā bhikkhunisaṅghassa cīvaratthāya chandakaṃ saṅgharitvā aññatarassa pāvārikassa ghare parikkhāraṃ nikkhipitvā bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.2.eng: At that time the lay followers collected voluntary contributions to supply the Sangha of nuns with robes. They stored the requisites in a cloth merchant’s shop, and then went to the nuns and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.2.comm: “Requisites” renders parikkhāra. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.3.pli: “amukassa, ayye, pāvārikassa ghare cīvaratthāya parikkhāro nikkhitto, tato cīvaraṃ āharāpetvā bhājethā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.3.eng: “Venerables, requisites to be used for robes are stored in such-and-such a cloth merchant’s shop. Please have someone get cloth from there and share it out.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.4.pli: Bhikkhuniyo tena parikkhārena bhesajjaṃ cetāpetvā paribhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.4.eng: But the nuns exchanged those requisites for tonics, which they then used.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.4.comm: “Tonics” renders bhesajja. See discussion of this word in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.5.eng: When the lay followers found out about this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.6.eng: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ upāsakānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.7.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those lay followers,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.8.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.9.eng: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.13.eng: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.16.1.eng: ‘When a requisite belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.5.eng: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.6.eng: it was given for a specific purpose.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.8.eng: belonging to the Sangha, not to a group, not to an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.10.pli: yaṃatthāya dinnaṃ, taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ cetāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.10.eng: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.11.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.12.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.12.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.13.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.14.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.15.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.15.eng: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a requisite belonging to the Sangha that was designated for a specific purpose, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.1.pli: Aññadatthike aññadatthikasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.1.eng: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.2.pli: Aññadatthike vematikā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.2.eng: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.3.pli: Aññadatthike anaññadatthikasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.3.eng: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.4.eng: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.4.comm: Yathādāne upanetabbaṁ. This is explained at Vmv 2.740: Nissaṭṭhaṁ paṭilabhitvāpi yaṁ uddissa dāyakehi dinnaṁ, tattheva dātabbaṁ. Tenāha “yathādāneyeva upanetabba”nti, “Having obtained what was relinquished, it is to be given in accordance with the designation of the donors. Yathādāneyeva upanetabbaṁ is said in regard to this.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.5.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.6.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.7.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.2.comm: This seems to mean that if there is a remainder after the requisites have been used as intended, then this may be exchanged for something other than what it was specified for. Sp 2.762: Sesakaṁ upanetīti yadatthāya dinno, taṁ cetāpetvā avasesaṁ aññassatthāya upaneti, “She uses the remainder means: after exchanging it for the purpose for which it was given, she uses the remainder for another purpose.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.3.eng: if she uses it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.3.comm: That is, if she makes use of it in another way than what was intended by the owners. Sp 2.762: Sāmike apaloketvāti “tumhehi cīvaratthāya dinno, amhākañca cīvaraṁ atthi, telādīhi pana attho”ti evaṁ āpucchitvā upaneti, “After getting permission from the owners means: she makes use of it after asking, ‘It was given by you for the purpose of robes, but we have robes and we need oil, etc.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.4.1.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “emergency” for āpadāsu, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.6.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:0.5.eng: The second training rule on exchanging what belongs to the Sangha

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upāsakā bhikkhunisaṅghassa cīvaratthāya chandakaṃ saṅgharitvā aññatarassa pāvārikassa ghare parikkhāraṃ nikkhipitvā bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.2.eng: At that time the lay followers collected voluntary contributions to supply the Sangha of nuns with robes. They stored the requisites in a cloth merchant’s shop, and then went to the nuns and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.3.pli: “amukassa, ayye, pāvārikassa ghare cīvaratthāya parikkhāro nikkhitto, tato cīvaraṃ āharāpetvā bhājethā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.3.eng: “Venerables, requisites to be used for robes are stored in such-and-such a cloth merchant’s shop. Please have someone get cloth from there and share it out.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.4.pli: Bhikkhuniyo tena ca parikkhārena sayampi yācitvā bhesajjaṃ cetāpetvā paribhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.4.eng: But even though they had asked for them, the nuns exchanged those requisites for tonics, which they then used.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.5.eng: When the lay followers found out about this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.6.eng: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.10.eng: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.12.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.13.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:1.13.1.eng: ‘When a requisite belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.5.eng: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.6.eng: it was given for a specific purpose.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.8.eng: belonging to the Sangha, not to a group, not to an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.10.eng: that she herself had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.13.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.14.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.17.eng: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a requisite belonging to the Sangha that was designated for a specific purpose and had been asked for, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np7:2.26.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
